intro: Agalinis calycina, commonly known as the narrowleaf false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Agalinis calycina is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a short-lived annual plant.
